content: Creation of new topic for the C-CDA Implementation-A-Thon.
(deleted)
January 2018 IAT Topics

we're wading through potential agenda items for the January event. We will retain our usual format: exchange, discussion topics, Ask the ONC, etc. Are there specific discussion topics or exchange scenarios you would like to see?

I have not previously attended an implementation-a-thon. A few questions.
Location- Will there be internet access (e.g. connecting to hosted services)? Is there any recommended hardware (e.g. cables, power strips)?
Content- Are there prescribed patients that should be configured before arrival? Is there prescribed patient content that needs to be configured?
How are documents shared?

George,
First, welcome aboard. Glad you've posted these questions on Zulip.

Regarding the location's internet access, etc. Yes, there will be internet access and power strips in the class room. When I seek out locations, I indicate that we need the following:

Room Type: Classroom layout with outlets and power strips for attendees to plug in their laptops
Equipment Needed: Wireless Internet, projector/screen, outlets for laptops
Wifi Requirements: Fairly simple -- General internet access which allows access to “Dropbox” and transmission of simple text files; Participants can access email hosted on Exchange servers, Participants can use VPN to access machines at their office

Regarding your content/configuration questions....I'll defer to Jean or Joginder (the IAT speakers) to address anything in more detail. They will be sending out scenarios in the coming week or so along with a little homework so that you can get the data situated and hit the ground running when we are at the IAT.

Scenarios used in past IATs can be viewed on the HL7 Wiki at:
http://wiki.hl7.org/index.php?title=C-CDA:_Enhancing_Implementation_(ONC_Grant_Project)

How are documents shared?
In the past, Dropbox has been used. Jean or Joginder can weigh in here if we're going to use a different method.

In the coming weeks, you'll start receiving a lot more information to prep for the IAT. I always send out a 'helpful hints' email containing general information, and then I'll be forwarding informaton on behalf of Jean and Joginder, simply so you are getting info from a sole source.

Always feel free to post questions to the Zulip chat. I'm on Zulip most of the day and Jean and Joginder monitor it as well.
Thank you for the detailed response. Any content needs specific to this testing earlier information is better, limited resources etc.

Hi @George Dixon . We are in the midst of finalizing the agenda and will be sending out information re: homework scenarios, discussion topics etc. towards the end of this week. At that point, we will also create an Confluence (wiki) page for the IAT that will serve as the event's information hub.

The IAT will be 9am-5pm ET each day; HL7 Staff will be available at 8:30am.

Loyola University
Danna Student Center
The Learn Lab (2nd Floor)

New Orleans, LA 70118

*Note that the address is for the entire campus; our building is nestled in the center of campus. Hence, being dropped off on West Road or Calhoun Street seems to be better than St. Charles Ave.

As we prepare the agenda for the upcoming IAT, we are asking participants if there are topics that they feel should be considered for inclusion - either as discussion topics or scenarios to test. If there is something you would like us to consider for inclusion, please send us a note and we will do our best to accommodate.

To date, we've received requests to include the following:

• Clinical Notes scenario/discussion
• Procedure Note
• Progress Note
• CCD vs. Discharge Summary vs. Progress note scenario
• Discharge Note in a Discharge summary Document
• Discharge Note in a CCD that is a 6 month summary.
• Care Plan scenario (particularly General Care Plans and Specialty Care Plans)
• Medication administered vs. historical vs. dispensed vs. med list
• VSAC (from the perspective of updates made in last 4 weeks to bring everyone up to date)
• History and Physical Note
• Ask the ONC discussion
• Discussion around the C-CDA scorecard and Rubric
• Implementer feedback about the use of the Mental Status and Functional Status sections and the associated entries

As discussed in yesterday's prep call, for your review, here are the scenario docs that reside on the Confluence IAT page...

Care Plan Scenarios

Care-Plan-Scenarios-v2_20180115.docx

Medication Section Scenarios

Medication-Section-Scenarios-1_20180115.docx

Clinical Note Template Scenarios

Clinical-Notes-Template-Scenarios_20180115.docx

And to assist everyone getting to the Danna Student Center, here's the campus map I reviewed in yesterday's call

campus-map-april-2016.pdf

Pregnancy Observation
Pregnancy observation is an assertion in C-CDA 2.1. eICR requires the ability to negate a pregnancy (over a period of time). On receiving a C-CDA document, are vendors expecting negated pregnancy in the pregnancy observation template?

New UDI templates - Implantable Device Instance template (conforms to Product Instance)
Is the purpose of this template to be used only for implantable Devices? How is is handle in context of product instance? Is it meant to replace the product instance template? Are both expected to be used - if so - what are guiding principles?
Care Plan view - Need a concise way of viewing the care plan elements in the context of it's linkages to be able to show the clinical picture.

We will add these to our list of potential discussion topics. Is the pregnancy observation question covered by section of the C-CDA R2.1 Companion Guide? It states "To indicate a patient was not pregnant during a specified date range, the Pregnancy Observation should also be used, but with a negationInd set to 'true'..."

Provenance
Provenance is listed as one of upcoming data elements on USCDI list. Suggesting discussing the definition of provenance, data elements and determine if there are existing implementation of provenance today.
Topic: use of the text node in the note section template (Companion guide new templates)
Hi Everyone. The notes from this week's in-person IAT are up - http://confluence.hl7.org:8090/display/IAT/20180125-26+IAT

@Yash Panchal @Jean Duteau @Joginder Madra Yash, I was forwarded the questions that you raised:

1) About the event, Is there only introductory discussions among all or there would be live testing of interoperability use cases?

Answer:
The IAT will be both discussions as well as exchanging of data. The data stems from scenarios that are created and distributed a week prior to the event.

2) Considering that we will be exporting CCD files, What is expected to be destinations and raw data?
Answer:
We'll have attendees that represent both sending organizations and receiving organizaztions.

The VIAT faciliators, Jean Duteau and Joginder Madra are on this Zulip chat as well so they can expand on the answers as well.

To clarify 2), we have tried to remove complexities around the mechanics of actual document exchange as we want to focus IAT time on "content". With that in mind, we will be setting up a Dropbox folder where participants can put/retrieve their C-CDA documents
@Joginder Madra You mean to say we will post CDA documents on central location so that everyone can access it.
that is correct

Hi Everyone. By now you should have received three scenario documents for Thursday's Virtual IAT. We would like participants to have their C-CDA documents created and ready to exchange for Thursday. As in the past, we will set up a Dropbox folder to facilitate the document exchange.

We will also be posting the documents to the Virtual IAT page in Confluence - http://confluence.hl7.org/display/IAT/20180628+-+Virtual+IAT

Registered participants should receive an invite to the event's Dropbox folder by EOD Wednesday.

Virtual IAT Registrants…

Sending this helpful information again…

The Virtual IAT will be 10:30am-4:30pm ET.
Short breaks will be incorporated, however, please prepare accordingly for quick snack, lunch and bio-breaks.

Home work scenarios have been sent to all registrants. Let me know if you have not received them or have questions about them.

IAT Project Page – (Confluence Page)

http://confluence.hl7.org/display/IAT/20180628+-+Virtual+IAT

Event Start Up

If you don’t have this information, please contact me at pmo@HL7.org. These credentials are unique to each registrant, meaning only one person is allowed access to the webinar with the credentials.

Issues during the webinar? I’ll be monitoring the entire event so please email me if you encounter issues.

Other Information
A survey will be sent to all attendees following the Virtual IAT. Please take a few minutes to complete it as we really value your input.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Any clarification on the 'versioning' scenarios? They seem a little fuzzy, though I know sometimes that's intentional! :) Is the intent to explore various combinations of the RPLC vs APND document relationship types?
Yes exactly. In the CDA tutorials that I teach, I have pretty much these exact scenarios so I thought I’d use that as the scenarios to see what implementers can do.

Hi all, I happened across a new OID for the MBI (new Medicare Beneficiary Identifier) that replaces the HICN starting in April of this year. I am curious if generators of the CCDA Payer (or Record Target) section are using the new OID (2.16.840.1.113883.4.927 ) as well as the old HICN OID (2.16.840.1.113883.4.572 ) Or have you kept the old or entirely switched over to the new? (Something tells me that the answer is "it depends" and is how user configures it? Appreciate your insight.

Hello All,
I am developing CCDA Consultation Notes for the first time. Can anyone please share some realtime usecases around it? Like how industry is using and more?

Thank you
Yash Panchal

C-CDA IAT Zulipers..

don’t forget about the upcoming C-CDA IAT in Washington DC on Aug 9-10.

Planned scenarios/discussions are:
- Encounter summary (i.e. discharge summary or progress note) vs patient summary (CCD)
- CDA -> FHIR Mapping (focusing on US data elements)*
- Care Plan**
- Ask the ONC

*We are also looking to demonstrate round-tripping between C-CDA to FHIR then back to C-CDA and, if possible, a "real" FHIR server/application to consumer. If you can help out with this or want more information, contact Dave Hamill at pmo@HL7.org.

**The Care Plan scenario file now includes a 4th assignment that will have implementers exercise the Health Status Evaluation and Outcomes section to hold assessment information covering the sexy topics of eLTSS and Social Determinants of Health!

The draft agenda can be found at:
http://confluence.hl7.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=21856369

http://www.hl7.org/events/c-cda/implementation/2018/08/

I am pleased to announce the upcoming HL7 C-CDA Implementation-A-Thon on January 12-13 2018
The C-CDA IAT will be conducted as a track within the FHIR Connectathon held in San Antonio, TX, just prior to the HL7 Working Group and Payer Summit.

Registration Information and everything you need to know about C-CDA IAT can be found on Confluence: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/IAT/Implementation-A-Thons

Register TODAY! Be a part of an exciting new way to learn about and continuously improve adoption of C-CDA.

FHIR Connectathon includes an exciting new track!! The CCDA Implementation-A-Thon (C-CDA IAT) is now being held in conjunction with the FHIR Connectathon. The CCDA IAT helps implementers work to reduce inconsistencies in HL7 C-CDA® implementations across the healthcare industry. The track also includes collaboration aimed at clarifying C-CDA document creation questions and exploratory sessions designed to bring clarity for less defined or emerging data representation in C-CDA.

Registration for the C-CDA IAT Track allows participants to optimize their participation across CDA and FHIR related Tracks. You can participate in the structured CCDA IAT track activities that suit your needs and interests, or take time out to participate in other aspects of the FHIR Connectathon. With the FHIR Connectathon happening at the same time, CDA implementers gain the opportunity to test crossover functionality like the FHIR Conversion Challenge (C-CDA to C-CDA on FHIR bidirectional document conversion).

The CDA IAT Track agenda is broken out by 90 minute quarters. This will facilitate your ability to focus on just the CCDA topics of interest to you and your organization. Of course, if they are all of interest, you can participate in all eight quarters. In addition to the C-CDA on FHIR and attachments quarter, the CDA IAT Track will include quarters on Data Provenance, Care Plan Documents, USCDI (US Core Data for Interoperability) and will cover review of the the evolving ONC Scorecard Rubric. It also includes pre-Connectathon virtual working sessions to introduce each topic and focus participants on getting the most out of their hands-on time in January. This track is ideal for CDA Implementers interested in gaining exposure to FHIR and the possibilities for harnessing both. The timing also makes it ideal for gaining exposure to CDA and FHIR prior to attending the Payor Summit.

Are you interested in learning more about
the January 2019 HL7 C-CDA Implementation-A-Thon (C-CDA IAT)?

Expand your expertise and gain more experience with:
• Encounter Summary Documents and Patient Summary Documents
• Data Provenance
• Care Plan Documents
• USCDI (US Core Data for Interoperability)
• C-CDA Scorecard Rubric
• C-CDA on FHIR Documents

Who is committed to making ZULIP a great place to chat with others who are implementing C-CDA and C-CDA on FHIR? Let's get this party started!!!!

HEY! Guess what? We decided to move the conversation to chat.FHIR.org. There's way more activity over there! Plus this will make it easier to monitor the CDA IAT and other FHIR Tracks at the same time in January--all from one place. You will need to get a separate account for chat.FHIR.org. Once you log in, you will see a stream for C-CDA IAT. Catch you there!

Why is PQ data type required to have a unit of measure when the datatype itself does not specify that? If this is the rule, does all PQ have to have a unit? Please see

https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/edge-test-tool/PfFu359S69E

September 2019 C-CDA Implementation-A-Thon—Together again at the FHIR Connectathon

SAVE THE DATE!
September 14-15, 2019
Atlanta Marriott Marquis, Atlanta GA

Join the C-CDA Community as we plan the agenda and select focal topics

The C-CDA Implementation-A-Thon (C-CDA IAT) is now being held as a track within the FHIR Connectathon. The C-CDA IAT helps implementers work to reduce inconsistencies in HL7 C-CDA® implementations across the healthcare industry. The track includes:
• Collaboration activities aimed at clarifying C-CDA document creation and consumption questions
• Exploratory sessions designed to clarify less defined or emerging C-CDA data representation
• Experimentation with sharing C-CDA documents using FHIR APIs

Registration for the C-CDA IAT Track allows participants to optimize their participation across CDA and FHIR related tracks, following the structured C-CDA IAT track activities of interest or partaking in other aspects of the FHIR Connectathon. The C-CDA IAT Track agenda is organized by 90-minute quarters. Participants can spend eight quarters over two days in the C-CDA IAT Track, or use some quarters to learn more about FHIR. Implementers determine what areas the track will cover at each session.

The C-CDA IAT includes pre-Connectathon preparation working sessions to introduce each topic and focus participants on getting the most out of their hands-on face-to-face time. This track is ideal for C-CDA implementers interested in gaining exposure to FHIR and the possibilities for harnessing both HL7 standards to meet emerging business use cases for information exchange. The timing also makes it ideal for gaining exposure to C-CDA and FHIR prior to attending the Payer Summit.
C-CDA Implementation-A-Thon September 2019

SAVE THE DATE!
September 14-15, 2019
Atlanta Marriott Marquis, Atlanta GA
Reply to this thread with topics of interest for the upcoming agenda. What areas of focus would be valuable to participants from your organization?
